The maximum liability of 26^000,000 is not increased,'Clause III' -i Soudan guaranteed Loan.,By the Trade Facilities and Loans Guarantee Act, 1922, the Treasury were authorised to guarantee the principal of and interest on any loan raised by the Government of the Soudan for irrigating the Gezireh Plain not exceeding an amount sufficient to raise 3,5Q0p00. The position then (December 1922) wa3 that the Soudan Government had spent over 5,000,000 raised under British guarantee under the Act of 1919 on the building of the Dam which is now being completed and that it would cost another 7,000,000 at least to build it. It was impossible while the relations of Egypt and the Soudan remained undetermined for the Soudan to hope to raise the money on their own credit. It was decided to guarantee 3 millions of the 7,000,000 required, the idea being that by the . time the balance was required the Soudan Government might be able to raise it by realisation of assets or that by -that time the relations between JUgypt and the Soudan would have been settled and the Soudan Government would have been able to raise a loan on its own credit. It iB now clear that neither alternative is possible and it is necessary therefore to guarantee a loan for the balancerequired required. It is proposed that the guarantee shall he for an amount sufficient to raise a further 3,500,000, making 7,000,000 in all under the Act of 1922, subject to the limits and conditions laid down in the 1922 Act.TR1ASTJRY,, .
